name: fish canning, large fish | fish canning, large fish | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/18563/documentation

The activity represents the canning of large fish in a canning plant. The functional unit is 1000 kg of raw material processed, excluding residues. The total raw material demand of this activity is 1000 kg of preprocessed raw material + the amount of residues generated by preprocessing (gutting, heading, tailing, peeling, filleting, etc). The life cycle inventories were produced based on a sample of 1 Ecuadorian plant (processing capacity: 61 000 t/y, representing 33% of the national processed tuna output). The data aplies to large fish such as tunids, swordfish, marlins, large flatfish and sharks. This activity can be used to model fish processing in other geographies.;Users must use this service activity in combination with an activity providing the raw material (fish).;System boundaries of fish processing for Direct Human Consumption (DHC) and relations between activities;Detailed system boundaries of DCH activities in Peru, including provision of fish from dedicated fleet

From delivery of consumables to the plant, through its Use phase (production), including all upstream activities (e.g. provision of infrastructure, fuels, electricity, chemicals and packaging materials).

Excludes fishery activities and provision of raw material (fish)
category: C:Manufacturing/10:Manufacture of food products/102:Processing and preserving of fish, crustaceans and molluscs/1020:Processing and preserving of fish, crustaceans and molluscs

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Production figures represent the period 2012-2013. Valid as of 2017.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Tuna processing activities of Ecuadorian fish canning plants, per t of processing capacity. Plants have a lifespan of 40 years.;Process diagram of large fish canning
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Data from tuna canning were assumed to represent the canning of other large fish
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
Data from 1 canning plant, opperated by the largest fish processing company in the country. This plant is representative of the current technology and managemen.
As of 2014 there were 27 active tuna canning plants, with an aggregated processing capacity of 671 400 t/y.

exchanges.description: Amount of raw material processed, excluding residues. The total raw material demand of this activity is 1000 kg of preprocessed raw material + the amount of residues generated by preprocessing (gutting, heading, tailing, peeling, filleting, etc).
